benchmark_details.name: LSDBench (Long-video Sampling Dilemma Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: LSDBench is the first benchmark designed to evaluate Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs) on long-video tasks by constructing questions characterized by high Necessary Sampling Density (NSD), addressing the sampling dilemma in long video analysis.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a standard evaluation for LVLMs in high-NSD scenarios, focusing on sampling efficiency and performance in long-video tasks.

data.source: 400 videos with corresponding action narrations annotated by human provided by EGO4D.
data.annotation: Fully automated QA generation pipeline with a two-round filtering process.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model performance on the LSDBench dataset through question answering tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Good performance is indicated by higher accuracy rates in answering questions while managing sampling efficiency.
